longBusinessSummary: United Energy Corp. engages in the development, manufacture, and sale of specialty chemical products in the United States and internationally. The company offers K-Line of chemical products for the oil industry, such as KH-30, a mixture of modified oils, dispersants, and oil-based surfactants to control paraffin and asphaltene deposits in oil wells; KX-100, a formula for the removal of a plug of paraffin or asphaltene; SR-3 scale and rust remover for the removal of calcium carbonate and calcium sulfate salt deposits; HPD-1 PLUS for remediation of tough clogging problems with upper medium to high molecular weight paraffin; and GSA Gun & Bore Cleaner, a bore and chamber cleaner for guns ranging from small handguns to 16Â guns. The company, through its subsidiary, Green Globe Industries, Inc., provides various solvents, paint strippers, and cleaners under the Qualchem trade name for the U.S. military. Green Globe's products include leak detection compound type I and II, a gas leak detection compound for detecting leaks in high and low-pressure oxygen systems in aircraft and other related oxygen systems; corrosion inhibitor, an additive for use with anti-freeze in water to retard corrosion; corrosion removing compound type I, II, and III, which include corrosion removing and metal conditioning compounds to remove rust from ferrous metal surfaces; ethylene glycol, a mixture of ethylene glycol and distilled water to provide a coolant mixture for use in radar domes used by the military; and NPX powder coating, a reusable paint stripper for stripping metals, including magnesium, zinc, high strength steel, and titanium. It markets and distributes its K-Line of chemical products through independent contractors in the United States, Mexico, South America, Africa, Europe, and the Middle East, as well as other products through distributors. The company was formerly known as Aztec Silver Mining Co. United Energy Corp. was founded in 1971 and is based in Sachse, Texas.
